alert.note: Alert for Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Lubbock, eastern Hockley, Hale and eastern Lamb Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 927 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow wind gusts from thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles east of Olton to 8 miles east of Anton to 6 miles west of Slide. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Strong outflow wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Plainview, Levelland, Slaton, Abernathy, Hale Center, Olton, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Petersburg, Anton, Ransom Canyon, Cotton Center, Fieldton, Spade, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Halfway, Slide and Woodrow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These strong wind gusts will arrive well in advance of any rainfall. Do not wait until you hear thunder or until rainfall arrives to begin preparing for strong wind gusts. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
